intro: Peschiera granulosa, commonly known as the granular peschiera, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, narrow leaves with a rough, granular texture. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a distinctive central disk surrounded by ray florets. Peschiera granulosa is often found in open grasslands and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
